Sudan - Agricultural Rehabilitation Project
            III : Credit 1866 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Sudan - Agricultural
            Rehabilitation Project III : Credit 1866 - Credit Agreement

docna.cdata!:
Sudan - Agricultural Rehabilitation Project
            III : Credit 1866 - Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Sudan - Agricultural
            Rehabilitation Project III : Credit 1866 - Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
This project seeks to finance (i)
            pesticides, jute sacks, fuel and lubricants, and spare
            parts; (ii) pesticide storage and handling facilities; and
            (iii) technical assistance and support services for
            strengthening the Ministries of Agriculture and Irrigation
            and the Agricultural Corporations. Further to this, the
            project aims to finance (iv) studies on (a) privatization of
            management of irrigation schemes on the Nile; (b)
            preparation of a national irrigation rehabilitation program;
            (c) development of the edible oil subsector, and (d)
            rehabilitation of gum arabic plantations.  In the short
            term, the project would sustain production in the irrigated
            subsector, support Government's stabilization program
            and pave the way for a more comprehensive economic recovery
            program.  In the medium term, it would improve the financial
            and accounting performance of agricultural parastatals and
            the operating efficiency of the Ministries of Agriculture
            and Irrigation.  Finally, in the long term, it would protect
            the environment from contamination from chemical pesticides,
            and assist with resolution of issues that prevent full
            exploitation of Sudan's irrigation potential.
